template.name: Kube by Prom API
template.description:
## Description
This template works out of the box as soon as Prometheus (Prometheus-operator) is available inside your cluster; it does not require any Zabbix agent installation or configuration. It allows external monitoring of the Kubernetes cluster through ingress, without any NodePort declaration. It uses the Prometheus API to create a Zabbix host for each pod available inside the Kubernetes cluster. {$PROM.API.URL} must contains the Prometheus entry point into your Kubernetes cluster. Zabbix pod hosts are created with the "Template Kube Pod by Prom API" template by default.
## Overview
### Description
zabbix-kube-prom is a batch of Zabbix LLD templates for Zabbix server.
It is used for external Kubernetes monitoring by Zabbix via Prometheus API.
### Installation
1. Install [kube-prometheus-stack](https://github.com/prometheus-community/helm-charts/tree/main/charts/kube-prometheus-stack) into the Kubernetes cluster. 2. Import global Zabbix Template (zabbix-kube-prom.xml) into your Zabbix server. 3. Create or import a host identifying your Kubernetes cluster where Prometheus is deployed. 4. Let LLD create discovered nodes as new "Zabbix hosts" 5. Let LLD create discovered pods as new "Virtual Zabbix hosts
### Templates
The global export (zabbix-kube-prom.xml) contains following templates:
| Templates | Description | | --- | --- | | Template Kube by Prom API | Creates a Zabbix host for each pod and node discovered. | | Template Kube Node by Prom API | Template applied to the created host (node). | | Template Kube Pod by Prom API | Template applied to the created host (pod). |
### Licenses
| Template | License | | --- | --- | | Template OS Linux by Prom | *GNU General Public License v2.0 or later*[Copyright (C) 2001-2021 Zabbix SIA](https://github.com/zabbix/zabbix/blob/master/README) | | Template Kube by Prom APITemplate Kube Node by Prom APITemplate Kube Pod by Prom API | *GNU General Public License v3.0*[Copyright (C) 2021 Diagnostica Stago](https://www.stago.com/) |
---
## Author
Laurent Marchelli

macro.description: Load per CPU considered sustainable. Tune if needed.

template.name: Kube Node by Prom API
template.description:
## Description
This template works out of the box as soon as Prometheus (Prometheus-operator) is available inside your cluster; it does not require any Zabbix agent installation or configuration. It allows external monitoring of the Kubernetes cluster through ingress, without any NodePort declaration. It uses the Prometheus API to create a Zabbix host for each pod available inside the Kubernetes cluster. {$PROM.API.URL} must contains the Prometheus entry point into your Kubernetes cluster. Zabbix pod hosts are created with the "Template Kube Pod by Prom API" template by default.
## Overview
### Description
zabbix-kube-prom is a batch of Zabbix LLD templates for Zabbix server.
It is used for external Kubernetes monitoring by Zabbix via Prometheus API.
### Installation
1. Install [kube-prometheus-stack](https://github.com/prometheus-community/helm-charts/tree/main/charts/kube-prometheus-stack) into the Kubernetes cluster. 2. Import global Zabbix Template (zabbix-kube-prom.xml) into your Zabbix server. 3. Create or import a host identifying your Kubernetes cluster where Prometheus is deployed. 4. Let LLD create discovered nodes as new "Zabbix hosts" 5. Let LLD create discovered pods as new "Virtual Zabbix hosts
### Templates
The global export (zabbix-kube-prom.xml) contains following templates:
| Templates | Description | | --- | --- | | Template Kube by Prom API | Creates a Zabbix host for each pod and node discovered. | | Template Kube Node by Prom API | Template applied to the created host (node). | | Template Kube Pod by Prom API | Template applied to the created host (pod). |
### Licenses
| Template | License | | --- | --- | | Template OS Linux by Prom | *GNU General Public License v2.0 or later*[Copyright (C) 2001-2021 Zabbix SIA](https://github.com/zabbix/zabbix/blob/master/README) | | Template Kube by Prom APITemplate Kube Node by Prom APITemplate Kube Pod by Prom API | *GNU General Public License v3.0*[Copyright (C) 2021 Diagnostica Stago](https://www.stago.com/) |
---
## Author
Laurent Marchelli
## Description
Official Linux template using node exporter. Known Issues: Description: node_exporter v0.16.0 renamed many metrics. CPU utilization for 'guest' and 'guest_nice' metrics are not supported in this template with node_exporter < 0.16. Disk IO metrics are not supported. Other metrics provided as 'best effort'. See https://github.com/prometheus/node_exporter/releases/tag/v0.16.0 for details. Version: below 0.16.0 Description: metric node_network_info with label 'device' cannot be found, so network discovery is not possible. Version: below 0.18 You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/387225-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-for-linux Template tooling version used: 0.34
## Overview
### Description
zabbix-kube-prom is a batch of Zabbix LLD templates for Zabbix server.
It is used for external Kubernetes monitoring by Zabbix via Prometheus API.
### Installation
1. Install [kube-prometheus-stack](https://github.com/prometheus-community/helm-charts/tree/main/charts/kube-prometheus-stack) into the Kubernetes cluster. 2. Import global Zabbix Template (zabbix-kube-prom.xml) into your Zabbix server. 3. Create or import a host identifying your Kubernetes cluster where Prometheus is deployed. 4. Let LLD create discovered nodes as new "Zabbix hosts" 5. Let LLD create discovered pods as new "Virtual Zabbix hosts
### Templates
The global export (zabbix-kube-prom.xml) contains following templates:
| Templates | Description | | --- | --- | | Template Kube by Prom API | Creates a Zabbix host for each pod and node discovered. | | Template Kube Node by Prom API | Template applied to the created host (node). | | Template Kube Pod by Prom API | Template applied to the created host (pod). |
### Licenses
| Template | License | | --- | --- | | Template OS Linux by Prom | *GNU General Public License v2.0 or later*[Copyright (C) 2001-2021 Zabbix SIA](https://github.com/zabbix/zabbix/blob/master/README) | | Template Kube by Prom APITemplate Kube Node by Prom APITemplate Kube Pod by Prom API | *GNU General Public License v3.0*[Copyright (C) 2021 Diagnostica Stago](https://www.stago.com/) |
---
## Author
Laurent Marchelli

item.name: Maximum number of open file descriptors
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

trigger.name: Configured max number of open filedescriptors is too low (< {$KERNEL.MAXFILES.MIN})

dependency.name: Running out of file descriptors (less than < 20% free)
dependency.expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:fd.open[node_exporter].last()}/{Kube Node by Prom API:kernel.maxfiles[node_exporter].last()}*100>80

trigger.name: node_exporter is not available (or no data for 30m)
trigger.description: Failed to fetch system metrics from node_exporter in time.

item.name: CPU guest time
item.description: Guest time (time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system)

item.name: CPU guest nice time
item.description: Time spent running a niced guest (virtual CPU for guest operating systems under the control of the Linux kernel)

item.name: CPU idle time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU interrupt time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU iowait time
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: CPU nice time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

step.params: //count the number of cores return JSON.parse(value).length

item.name: CPU softirq time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item.name: CPU steal time
item.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

item.name: CPU system time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU user time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item.name: CPU utilization
item.description: CPU utilization in %

trigger.name: High CPU utilization (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for 5m)
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

dependency.name: Load average is too high (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)

item.name: System description
item.description: Labeled system information as provided by the uname system call.

step.params: var info = JSON.parse(value)[0]; return info.sysname + ' version: ' + info.release + ' ' + info.version;

item.name: System local time
item.description: System local time of the host.

trigger.name: System time is out of sync (diff with Zabbix server > {$SYSTEM.FUZZYTIME.MAX}s)
trigger.description: The host system time is different from the Zabbix server time.

item.name: System name
item.description: System host name.

trigger.name: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Operating system architecture
item.description: Operating system architecture of the host.

trigger.name: Operating system description has changed
trigger.description: Operating system description has changed. Possible reasons that system has been updated or replaced. Ack to close.

dependency.name: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
dependency.expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:system.name[node_exporter].diff()}=1 and {Kube Node by Prom API:system.name[node_exporter].strlen()}>0

item.name: Free swap space
item.description: The free space of swap volume/file in bytes.

item.name: Free swap space in %
item.description: The free space of swap volume/file in percent.

item.name: Total swap space
item.description: The total space of swap volume/file in bytes.

item.name: System uptime
item.description: System uptime in 'N days, hh:mm:ss' format.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has been restarted (uptime < 10m)
trigger.description: The device uptime is less than 10 minutes

item.name: Available memory
item.description: Available memory, in Linux, available = free + buffers + cache. On other platforms calculation may vary. See also: https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/current/manual/appendix/items/vm.memory.size_params

item.name: Total memory
item.description: Total memory in Bytes

item.name: Memory utilization
item.description: Memory used percentage is calculated as (total-available)/total*100

trigger.name: High memory utilization ( >{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}% for 5m)
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

dependency.name: Lack of available memory ( < {$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
dependency.expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:vm.memory.available[node_exporter].min(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Kube Node by Prom API:vm.memory.total[node_exporter].last()}>0

discovery_rule.name: Network interface discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of network interfaces. Requires node_exporter v0.18 and up.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Speed
item_prototype.description: Sets value to 0 if metric is missing in node_exporter output.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Operational status
item_prototype.description: Indicates the interface RFC2863 operational state as a string. Possible values are:"unknown", "notpresent", "down", "lowerlayerdown", "testing","dormant", "up". Reference: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/ABI/testing/sysfs-class-net

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].change()}<0 and {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}>0 and ( {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=6 or {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=7 or {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=11 or {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=62 or {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=69 or {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=117 ) and ({Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: ({Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].change()}>0 and {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].prev()}>0) or ({Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=2 and {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].change()}<0 and {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}>0 and ({Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=6 or {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=1) and ({Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: ({Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].change()}>0 and {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.type[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].prev()}>0) or ({Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=2 and {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: ({Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.in[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()} or {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.out[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}) and {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.in[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()} and {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.out[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.speed[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=2 and {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.in.errors[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].min(5m)}>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.out.errors[node_exporter"{#IFNAME}"].min(5m)}>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.in.errors[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].max(5m)}<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.out.errors[node_exporter"{#IFNAME}"].max(5m)}<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].last()}=2 and {Kube Node by Prom API:net.if.status[node_exporter,"{#IFNAME}"].diff()}=1)

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk average queue size (avgqu-sz)
item_prototype.description: Current average disk queue, the number of requests outstanding on the disk at the time the performance data is collected.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read request avg waiting time (r_await)
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two boolean expressions that evaluates to 1 or 0 in order to set calculated metric to zero and to avoid division by zero exception.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read rate
item_prototype.description: r/s. The number (after merges) of read requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read time (rate)
item_prototype.description: Rate of total read time counter. Used in r_await calculation

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk utilization
item_prototype.description: This item is the percentage of elapsed time that the selected disk drive was busy servicing read or writes requests.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write request avg waiting time (w_await)
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two boolean expressions that evaluates to 1 or 0 in order to set calculated metric to zero and to avoid division by zero exception.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write rate
item_prototype.description: w/s. The number (after merges) of write requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write time (rate)
item_prototype.description: Rate of total write time counter. Used in w_await calculation

trigger_prototype.expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:vfs.dev.read.await[node_exporter,"{#DEVNAME}"].min(15m)} > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} or {Kube Node by Prom API:vfs.dev.write.await[node_exporter,"{#DEVNAME}"].min(15m)} > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read/write request responses are too high (read > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 15m or write > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 15m)
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger might indicate disk {#DEVNAME} saturation.

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types.

trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left. As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.

trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left. As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:vfs.fs.pused[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Kube Node by Prom API:vfs.fs.total[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()}-{Kube Node by Prom API:vfs.fs.used[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()})<5G or {Kube Node by Prom API:vfs.fs.pused[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 5G. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:vfs.fs.pused[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Kube Node by Prom API:vfs.fs.total[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()}-{Kube Node by Prom API:vfs.fs.used[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()})<10G or {Kube Node by Prom API:vfs.fs.pused[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than 10G. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

dependency.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
dependency.expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:vfs.fs.pused[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Kube Node by Prom API:vfs.fs.total[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()}-{Kube Node by Prom API:vfs.fs.used[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].last()})<5G or {Kube Node by Prom API:vfs.fs.pused[node_exporter,"{#FSNAME}"].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)

macro.description: Load per CPU considered sustainable. Tune if needed.
Filter out loopbacks, nulls, docker veth links and docker0 bridge by default
Ignore notPresent(7)
TCP Port node_exporter is listening on.
This macro is used in block devices discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in block devices discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
Disk read average response time (in ms) before the trigger would fire
Disk write average response time (in ms) before the trigger would fire
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level

template.name: Kube Pod by Prom API
template.description:
## Description
This template works out of the box as soon as Prometheus (Prometheus-operator) is available inside your cluster; it does not require any Zabbix agent installation or configuration. It allows external monitoring of the Kubernetes cluster through ingress, without any NodePort declaration. It uses the Prometheus API to create a Zabbix host for each pod available inside the Kubernetes cluster. {$PROM.API.URL} must contains the Prometheus entry point into your Kubernetes cluster. Zabbix pod hosts are created with the "Template Kube Pod by Prom API" template by default.
## Overview
### Description
zabbix-kube-prom is a batch of Zabbix LLD templates for Zabbix server.
It is used for external Kubernetes monitoring by Zabbix via Prometheus API.
### Installation
1. Install [kube-prometheus-stack](https://github.com/prometheus-community/helm-charts/tree/main/charts/kube-prometheus-stack) into the Kubernetes cluster. 2. Import global Zabbix Template (zabbix-kube-prom.xml) into your Zabbix server. 3. Create or import a host identifying your Kubernetes cluster where Prometheus is deployed. 4. Let LLD create discovered nodes as new "Zabbix hosts" 5. Let LLD create discovered pods as new "Virtual Zabbix hosts
### Templates
The global export (zabbix-kube-prom.xml) contains following templates:
| Templates | Description | | --- | --- | | Template Kube by Prom API | Creates a Zabbix host for each pod and node discovered. | | Template Kube Node by Prom API | Template applied to the created host (node). | | Template Kube Pod by Prom API | Template applied to the created host (pod). |
### Licenses
| Template | License | | --- | --- | | Template OS Linux by Prom | *GNU General Public License v2.0 or later*[Copyright (C) 2001-2021 Zabbix SIA](https://github.com/zabbix/zabbix/blob/master/README) | | Template Kube by Prom APITemplate Kube Node by Prom APITemplate Kube Pod by Prom API | *GNU General Public License v3.0*[Copyright (C) 2021 Diagnostica Stago](https://www.stago.com/) |

## Author
Laurent Marchelli
## Description
Official Linux template using node exporter. Known Issues: Description: node_exporter v0.16.0 renamed many metrics. CPU utilization for 'guest' and 'guest_nice' metrics are not supported in this template with node_exporter < 0.16. Disk IO metrics are not supported. Other metrics provided as 'best effort'. See https://github.com/prometheus/node_exporter/releases/tag/v0.16.0 for details. Version: below 0.16.0 Description: metric node_network_info with label 'device' cannot be found, so network discovery is not possible. Version: below 0.18 You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/387225-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-for-linux Template tooling version used: 0.34
## Overview
### Description
zabbix-kube-prom is a batch of Zabbix LLD templates for Zabbix server.
It is used for external Kubernetes monitoring by Zabbix via Prometheus API.
### Installation
1. Install [kube-prometheus-stack](https://github.com/prometheus-community/helm-charts/tree/main/charts/kube-prometheus-stack) into the Kubernetes cluster. 2. Import global Zabbix Template (zabbix-kube-prom.xml) into your Zabbix server. 3. Create or import a host identifying your Kubernetes cluster where Prometheus is deployed. 4. Let LLD create discovered nodes as new "Zabbix hosts" 5. Let LLD create discovered pods as new "Virtual Zabbix hosts
### Templates
The global export (zabbix-kube-prom.xml) contains following templates:
| Templates | Description | | --- | --- | | Template Kube by Prom API | Creates a Zabbix host for each pod and node discovered. | | Template Kube Node by Prom API | Template applied to the created host (node). | | Template Kube Pod by Prom API | Template applied to the created host (pod). |
### Licenses
| Template | License | | --- | --- | | Template OS Linux by Prom | *GNU General Public License v2.0 or later*[Copyright (C) 2001-2021 Zabbix SIA](https://github.com/zabbix/zabbix/blob/master/README) | | Template Kube by Prom APITemplate Kube Node by Prom APITemplate Kube Pod by Prom API | *GNU General Public License v3.0*[Copyright (C) 2021 Diagnostica Stago](https://www.stago.com/) |
---

macro.description: Device regex used in pod's metric discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
Device interface regex used in pod's metric discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
Network interface regex used in pod's metric discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
Network interface regex used in pod's metric discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level.

trigger.expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:system.swap.pfree[node_exporter].min(5m)}<{$SWAP.PFREE.MIN.WARN} and {Kube Node by Prom API:system.swap.total[node_exporter].last()}>0
trigger.name: High swap space usage ( less than {$SWAP.PFREE.MIN.WARN}% free)
trigger.description: This trigger is ignored, if there is no swap configured

dependency.name: Lack of available memory ( < {$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
dependency.expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:vm.memory.available[node_exporter].min(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Kube Node by Prom API:vm.memory.total[node_exporter].last()}>0

trigger.expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:vm.memory.available[node_exporter].min(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Kube Node by Prom API:vm.memory.total[node_exporter].last()}>0
trigger.name: Lack of available memory ( < {$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
Load average is too high (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)
trigger.description: Per CPU load average is too high. Your system may be slow to respond.

trigger.expression: {Kube Node by Prom API:fd.open[node_exporter].last()}/{Kube Node by Prom API:kernel.maxfiles[node_exporter].last()}*100>80
trigger.name: Running out of file descriptors (less than < 20% free)
trigger.opdata: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} of {ITEM.LASTVALUE2} file descriptors are in use.
